alert.note: Alert for Jo Daviess (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 07 at 7:40AM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southwestern Jo Daviess, Jackson, northeastern Cedar, Dubuque, Jones, southeastern Delaware, northeastern Linn and northwestern Clinton Counties through 830 AM CDT... At 737 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Bankston to near Langworthy. Movement was southeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Dubuque, Maquoketa, Anamosa, Asbury, Dyersville, Monticello, Bellevue, Cascade, Epworth, Farley, Peosta, Hopkinton, Wyoming, Oxford Junction, Lost Nation, Andrew, Worthington, La Motte, Onslow and Prairieburg. Those attending the Camp Courageous Triathlon in Jones County are in the path of these storms and should prepare for occasional lightning, gusty winds around 40 mph, and heavy rainfall. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
